title.narrative: Resilience-building and improved employment opportunities through vocational training for internally displaced persons, refugees, and host communities in Northern Iraq

description.narrative: The overarching goal of the project is to continue assisting the Government of Iraq in supporting the livelihood needs of IDPs, Refugees and the host communities severely affected by the Mosul Liberation and ISIL conflict. The proposed project aims to do the following: 1) 250-300 IDPs, Refugees and Host community members trained in various technical and vocational training skills, 2) 1-2 Vocational Skills Training are enhanced in the government owned TVETS in Erbil and Dohuk. The project is designed in a way to compliment in the already existing projects to promote not only synergies and complementary activities but also cost-cutting measures because of the already established local team, support from the government and the working relationships with other agencies in the UN Country team. The project will build on this training infrastructure and cooperation with existing VTCs. The project concept will be submitted to the Austrian Government for funding.
